result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter E Spence was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Huber with standard release conditions.

To be paid FORTHWITH - in lieu of payment, defendant to serve an additional 5 days in the Waukesha County Jail, consecutive to the 6 months, but concurrent to Case 10CF814.

From Oregon Correctional.

Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Peter E Spence in court, in custody (by video conference from Oregon Correctional), with attorney Cameron Weitzner.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.


Court orders the following:
6 Months in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
Concurrent to:  Waukesha County case 10CF814.
To be served in the State Prison System.

Costs:  $243
To be paid - Forthwith - In Lieu of payment and additional 5 Days in the Waukesha County Jail - consecutive to the 6 months but concurrent to 10CF814.
